summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorney Gloria Allred's office, coordinating travel arrangements for two witnesses (presumed victims) to New York for meetings related to the grand jury investigation and trial preparation in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It details logistical planning, budget constraints, and clarifies that the meetings are for official testimony purposes.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney whose office is coordinating travel for two clients (witnesses) to meet with federal prosecutors in New York. Her executive assistant, Diane Aldrich, handles the logistics.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Handles all travel logistics and communication with the U.S. Attorney's Office for two witnesses represented by Gloria Allred. She provides flight details, hotel preferences, and coordinates car service.

connections.description: Diane Aldrich is the executive assistant to attorney Gloria Allred, acting on her behalf to coordinate witness travel.
Gloria Allred is representing two clients who are witnesses traveling to New York for meetings with prosecutors.
They are in direct communication to arrange government-funded travel, hotels, and car service for the witnesses.

events.title: Witness Interviews/Meetings in New York
events.description: Planned meetings in New York between federal prosecutors and two witnesses represented by Gloria Allred. The meetings are characterized as part of grand jury investigation and trial preparation.

events.title: Witness Travel to New York
events.description: One witness is scheduled to take a redeye flight from Las Vegas to JFK, arriving the morning of July 29, 2019.

locations: Southern District of New York (prosecuting office jurisdiction)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office address)
Lotte New York Palace, 455 Madison Avenue at 50th (proposed meeting location and hotel)
50 Bowery (address where one witness was to be dropped off)
Las Vegas (origin city for one witness)
keyFacts: The correspondence confirms an active grand jury investigation and trial preparation in the Epstein case as of July 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is arranging and funding travel for witnesses (presumed victims) to come to New York, indicating their cooperation with the prosecution.
There is a specific policy debate within the prosecution team about whether witness travel is permissible only for formal grand jury or trial testimony, not for informal 'interviews'.
Attorney Gloria Allred's office is actively involved in representing and facilitating the travel of at least two witnesses for these proceedings.
Logistical details include government travel restrictions, per diem rates ($76 for two days), and a witness fee of $40 per day.
